item.title: JWWbooktiger add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "For some of us, books are as important as almost anything else on earth. What a miracle it is that out of these small, flat, rigid squares of paper unfolds world after world after world, worlds that sing to you, comfort and quiet or excite you. Books help us understand who we are and how we are to behave. They show us what community and friendship mean; they show us how to live and die." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: JWWbooktiger add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "I thought such awful thoughts that I cannot even say them out loud because they would make Jesus want to drink gin straight out of the cat dish." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: JWWbooktiger add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "You can either practice being right or practice being kind." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: JWWbooktiger add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Perfectionism is the voice of the oppressor, the enemy of the people. It will keep you cramped and insane your whole life, and it is the main obstacle between you and a shitty first draft. I think perfectionism is based on the obsessive belief that if you run carefully enough, hitting each stepping-stone just right, you won't have to die. The truth is that you will die anyway and that a lot of people who aren't even looking at their feet are going to do a whole lot better than you, and have a lot more fun while they're doing it." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: JWWbooktiger add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Almost all good writing begins with terrible first efforts. You need to start somewhere." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: JWWbooktiger add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Not forgiving is like drinking rat poison and then waiting for the rat to die." -- Anne Lamott
